Don't you see... it's all falling apart. EXT. BROOKLYN BRIDGE вЂ” NIGHT W.F. and Thomas stand under the first storied arch. Manhattan twinkles to one side, Brooklyn to the other. It's late, no people. wW.F. chomps on his cigar. W.F. Do you think he's in love with her?
I'm in love with her. W.F. Is he? As Thomas stops and ponders the illuminated dotted skylin (CONTINUED)
I think so. W.F. You and your father are suffering from the same disease.
Johanna. They resume their stroll.
How come you're writing about me? W.F. Because that's what I do. I write about people I know and thinly veil it by giving them different names and professions.

But why me? W.F. Because your story interests me. Look, I got the apartment to get out of the house and write this completely other story but it just didn't come across. Thomas looks back over to W.F.
And mine did. W.F. Yes. Like everything good, it happened by accident. I had writer's block. I met you. Now, I have three hundred and nine pages. Thomas accepts that. They walk in silence, until...
My father's publishing house is throwing an anniversary party tomorrow night... will you come? W.F. Why? (CONTINUED)
You've heard about all these people but you've never met them. It'll help your book. It's a hot event Will you come? W.F. I don't know. Thomas walks off into the night...
I'll leave the invitation at your door.

A cab pulls up out in front of the old tenement building waits. Dressed down but done up, Mimi emerges and runs ou to the cab. INT. CAB вЂ” NIGHT Mimi gets in and smiles to Thomas. No greeting, no words, just a smile. They ride in silence. Until... Mimi takes his hand, kisses him on the cheek.
You look nice. And she doesn't let go of his hand.
I thought you never turn. She whispers into his ear.
We only turn when you turn away. It's maddening. As he looks out the window.
Then we're never looking at each other. INT. THE RAINBOW ROOM вЂ” NIGHT At the top of Rockefeller Plaza. The view is incredible. (CONTINUED)

Mimi and Thomas step out of the elevator into the swingin event. The literati energy buzzing palpable. Commerce meets art. Some are in longhairs in Chuck Taylor while others are polished in Prada. The kind of party whe poignant philosophical debates occupy the same table as superficial book deals. Everybody's drunk. Everybody's table-hoping. Everybody's fabulous. A quiet jazz band provides the music. Judith and Nathan hold court with some of the partygoers. Thomas stops and looks at them. Mimi at his side.
They look so happy.
Doesn't everyone here? Mimi looks around smiles. This is her vibe.
Thomas. Mimi. Thomas and Mimi join his parent's group.

You remember David Remnick. They join the conversation while Nathan throws on a plast smile and goes to greet another partygoer Thomas takes in the party... sees a familiar face at the Heads over to it.
swirls his Scotch around in the glass as he stands next t the bar... in the shadows... out of everybody's eyesight.
Thanks for coming. W.F. It's a great party.
It always is. There's Mimi talking with my mother. Thomas points over to Mimi. W.F. takes them in. (CONTINUED)
She's beautiful.
I told you she was. W.F. I was talking about your mother

talking to a circle of partygoers with Mimi in it. She's on a healthy face, full of life, entertaining them all wi some story. Thomas joins and waits patiently. Judith finishes. Thomas grabs her attention.
I want you to meet someone. He leads both his mother and Mimi toward the bar.
Who are we meeting, Thomas? As Thomas arrives at the bar. Looks around.
My new friend. W.F. is nowhere to be found.
He was just here. Judith sees someone she knows and heads to greet them.
We'll meet him later, Dear. Thomas is left with Mimi.
He was just here. As Mimi simply shrugs.
martini in her hand... alone... pondering the buildings b that line 5th avenue. (CONTINUED)

Somebody now stands at her side. W.F. "I have looked down upon the city from high windows. It is then that the great buildings lose reality and take on magical powers. Squares and squares of flame set and cut into the ether. Here's our poetry... for we have pulled down the stars to our will." Johanna turns. Faces him.
That's very beautiful. Is it yours? W.F. Ezra Pound.
I'm Johanna. W.F. Ahh, Johanna. Yes, I assumed it was you.
Have we met? W.F. No but I know you very well. W.F. looks right at her. Piercing.
You're every girl I've ever loved and every girl that's ever rejected me.

This conversation is growing strange. His piercing eyes. Even tone. Dead serious... W.F. I know you're having your fun. He's young and he's easy. But you'll have me to deal with if he scars. (CONTINUED)
Johanna's face forms a plastic smile. She speaks through

I don't like strange conversations so I'm going to walk away now. Johanna slowly walks away from W.F. who watches her every graceful step. INT. THE RAINBOW ROOM вЂ” LATER Mimi talks with a FEMALE AUTHOR she admires as Thomas tak in the whole party. Mimi grabs him into a hug and kisses on the lips. A quick one. It catches him off guard.
I just met J.T. Leroy. This is so much fun.
admiring her youthful giddiness. Drinking in its intoxication. As she takes him by the hand.
Dance with me, Thomas Webb.
Nobody's dancing. She leads him in front of the band.
I know. And they dance to a slow number. Swaying back and forth i good cadence with each other. She whispers into his ear.
How long have you wanted me?
Since the moment you recommended "Taps At Reveille."
That was the day we met. Thomas slowly confirms this. Then...
Are you going to Croatia? (CONTINUED)
Do you want me to stay? She stops dancing.
I'll stay, Thomas. And she kisses him. This time it's a longer one.
If you want me to. Thomas looks to Mimi but over her shoulder... standing alone... staring right at them... Johanna. Thomas locks eyes with Johanna, then back to Mimi.
You have to excuse me. Thomas breaks their embrace. Leaves a confused and hurt Mimi. Walks quickly toward Johanna... and past her. As he passes.
I need to talk to you. INT. KITCHEN вЂ” NIGHT Johanna follows Thomas in.
I have to talk to you as well.
You're destroying my family. He glares at her.
What happened to you? Somewhere in your life, you... I don't know, lost your way. Why are you so... It trails off. Until...
Yes, Thomas? (CONTINUED)
Inhuman.
Maybe I didn't lose my way -- maybe I had it taken from me.
You were... abused. She looks away and slowly nods.
I'm sorry. And she cracks into a smile. And laughs.
Is something funny?
Yes. You, Thomas. Your clichГ©d world. Your black and white existence. Your seat in the first row of psychology one-o-one and your hand raised so excitedly.
You weren't abused.
No, Thomas. But I've been overcharged before so maybe that's why I donвЂ™t wear white. He glares at her. Hurt.
Fuck you.
I am who I am. He moves toward her -- determined.
I want you out of our lives. I thought I loved you but you can't be loved. (and then) (MORE) (CONTINUED)
You're sick and you lie and you seduce and God made a mistake when he made you beautiful.
Are you finished? He takes a breath, thinks about it, then...
Yes.
I'm sorry you feel that way.
Well, I do. As Johanna lets out a superficial sigh...
Well, you surely won't be the first little boy who hates his stepmother.
What?
That's right, Thomas. Your father and I are to get married. He proposed to me yesterday. Thomas violently shakes his head.
No, he's going through a mid-life crises. You're a symptom... you're not permanent.
But I am. He's leaving your mother. That's why he wants you to live closer to home. Thomas stands in shock
It was his decision. See, despite everything... She draws in a long drag. Then... (CONTINUED)
I can be loved.
What do you think is going to happen? That you guys are going to get married, have the obligatory second family and live happily ever after?
Well, that obviously can't happen.
What is that supposed to mean?
Think about it. He stands there, very befuddled.
You're infertile? And she says it very slowly.
No. Johanna turns to go but Thomas grabs her by the arm... tu her back around.
I'll tell him about us. I'll tell him everything!

I don't think you have the balls Let's face it... you're not your father. As she rips away from his grasp... INT. THE RAINBOW ROOM вЂ” NIGHT Thomas returns to the party. He looks across the room to his mother being introduced to Johanna by another guest. And Thomas Webb can't take it anymore.  81.
Thomas rushes out of the building. Quickly walks down 5th Avenue. In the light drizzle of rain. Mimi emerges from the building and runs after him.
Thomas! Thomas! He stops and turns.
It's raining. He nods. They hold the moment.
And I think I'm falling in love with you.
Shopenhauer was right, Mimi. Nothing we do matters.
It's not true, Thomas. She steps toward him.
I slept with her. I slept with Johanna. Mimi stands still. In the rain. As her face washes white.
No.
And I thought I loved her.
No. Thomas... your not like that You're good.
No, Mimi, I'm not good. I'm just... And it trails off... and it rains... and she stands there (CONTINUED)
Crushed, Mimi just looks at him. Tears being washed down face from the rain. And she turns around and runs. Thomas takes in a breath, then...
Mimi... wait. He runs after her. Runs in the rain down 5th Avenue and catches her, turns her around.
Mimi, you're all I wanted. Her mascara running down her face.
Let me go! I thought you were someone else. But you're just like them.
Mimi, please...

They've won, Thomas... they've bankrupted you. She rips away from him, flags down a cab. And he lets her go. EXT. CENTRAL PARK вЂ” NIGHT Under the light rain, Thomas walks into the park And he walks. And it rains. And he walks. Until Thomas stops. He stops and simply stands there... a lets the sky piss down on him. EXT. CENTRAL PARK вЂ” MORNING Thomas awakens on a bench. As he stands and stretches. INT. METROPOLITAN MUSEUM вЂ” MORNING Wet and dirty, Thomas stares at Rodin's "Hand Of God." He doesn't move. As a TOUR GUIDE brings through a group of about fifteen CHILDREN. (CONTINUED)

Rodin had a deep knowledge of the art of the Middle Ages and the Renaissance. (a beat) People have debated since its creation whether this hand of God is coddling the man and woman or whether it's about to squeeze them. Thomas loudly exclaims.
It's about to squeeze them.
Well, that's the debate. Thomas turns to the group of children...
No debate... it's about to squeeze the shit out of them. Tour Guide regards Thomas then smiles over to her group..
Okay, let's move on to the French Impressionists. INT. WEBB'S RIVERSIDE DRIVE BROWNSTONE/KITCHEN вЂ” DAY Judith smokes. She's frantic.
He left early this morning. He said he had to get some files from the office.
I need to talk to him. Judith regards her son.
What's going on, Thomas?
Nothing, Mom. I just need his advice on something. (CONTINUED)
Father, son stuff?
Right. This makes her smile.
I've planned a trip to Grand Caymen. He needs it. He's most at peace when he's diving.
I don't know if that-- She interrupts her son.
Oh, but don't tell him... I want it to be a surprise. She's giddy with her plan. Thomas capitulates to her mani
I won't, Mom. EXT. KENTA-WEBB OFFICES вЂ” DAY Thomas stands with a SECURITY GUARD outside the offices.
It's Sunday.
I know but I think my father came in to get some files.

I'll have to escort you in. INT. NATHAN'S OFFICE вЂ” DAY Thomas stands with the Guard. Nobody is in the office. Thomas walks over to the desk. He looks at the pictures o it. Pictures taken throughout the years of Nathan and Judith. And pictures of Thomas from baby to present And he looks over to a corkboard wall where there are articles on Kenta-Webb and its rise with-in the publishin world. And Thomas' accomplishments and awards. (CONTINUED)
I gotta lock up. Transfixed, Thomas slowly nods. But he sees something in of the pictures. He takes it off the board and looks at i intensely. We now see it.

head_text.subj: THOMAS WINNING A TENNIS MATCH IN HIGH SCHOOL

text: A long shot of him throwing his racket up in the air afte hitting the winning point. And in the crowd, behind Thoma stands W.F. Gerald. Younger but it's clearly him. Shocked, Thomas shoves the picture in his pocket.
Thomas bangs on W.F.'s door. No answer
Where the fuck are you? He kicks it. Kicks again. Asks a different question.

Who the fuck are you? EXT. JOHANNA'S SPRING STREET LOFT вЂ” DAY Thomas frantically rings the button. As the door buzzes. INT. JOHANNA'S SPRING STREET LOFT/HALLWAY вЂ” DAY Thomas bangs on the door. It opens. Nathan stands there.
Thomas, come in. INT. JOHANNA'S LOFT вЂ” DAY Nathan leads Thomas in.
Dad, I can explain how I knew you were here.
There's no need. I know everything.
You know everything? (CONTINUED)
I'm sorry to drag you through this.
What did she say?
You shouldn't have had to find out that way.
What did she say? Nathan sighs and has a seat.
She told me you saw us. And that you followed her and asked her to stop seeing me. I'm not angry at you, Thomas. Thomas laughs.
You're not angry at me? You're not angry at_me? What else did she say?
That you're hurt. That you're worried about your mother. And Thomas looks over to the kitchen where Johanna stands
Hello, Thomas.
Did she tell you we slept together? Did she tell you that she seduced me at the Metropolitan Museum and took me back here and slept with me? Nathan sadly shakes his head...
I understand this hurts you.
It's true. (CONTINUED)
Please... Thomas. Thomas steps forward. Steely determined. Says it again.
It's true.
No, Thomas, it's not. It can't be true. Thomas just stands there. Silence. An uncomfortable one.
Can I offer you a Poland Springs Thomas? Thomas just looks at her. She shrugs.
It's cold. He regards her a moment then looks back to his father.
Why not? Why can't it be true?
I don't think she'd do that to me and I know you wouldn't.
Well, we did. Six times. Nathan looks to Johanna who grimaces as if Thomas is so delusional that she actually feels sorry for him.
C'mon, Thomas. Let it go. Look it can't be true because... And Nathan's thought trails off.
Finish it. What were you going to say?
Nothing. (CONTINUED)
Finish it. "It can't be true because... because... Nathan simply sighs.
Because... I could never get a girl like Johanna."
I didn't say that.
But it's how you think. And as he lets himself out...

And that's so fucking sad. INT. 99 ORCHARD/HALLWAY вЂ” NIGHT Thomas bangs on W.F.'s door. No answer INT. W.F.'S APARTMENT вЂ” NIGHT Empty, until that window off the fire escape opens and Th heads in, makes his way to the...

which is empty. No desk or typewriter or manuscript or anything. Completely empty. INT. MIMI'S APARTMENT вЂ” MORNING Mimi lets him in. Her stuff is all scattered about with a few suitcases opened. She's packing.
(re: suitcases) Helmut said yes.
Don't go. She frenetically packs. Never to look up at him. (CONTINUED)
He takes a She keeps 89.
Thomas, you have issues... granted we all do... but I think yours may need some immediate consideration.
No, Mimi--
Croatia is a great opportunity for me and I really need to get off of Manhattan.
When do you go?
Tonight.
Tonight? This is crazy. This is-- what about what you said?
What did I say?
That you loved me.
Well, Thomas, I don't know if I do anymore... or if I ever even did. beat. Takes a breath. Then...
I love you. packing. Not looking back at him.
I love you.

I heard you, Thomas. (and with a sigh) But I'm still going to Croatia.  90. EXT. UPPER WEST SIDE вЂ” DAY Thomas heads down 83rd street. He reaches his home. He rings the bell. No answer. He reaches into his pocket for his keys. INT. WEBB RIVERSIDE BROWNSTONE вЂ” DAY Thomas wonders through the home.
Mom... hello... Mom. And when he gets into the kitchen, he stops cold.
crouched on the floor. Shaking. Weeping.
Mom...
(crying) Oh, Thomas. He scans the counter, for knifes... for empty pill bottle
Mom. I'm so sorry. WeвЂ™re going to make it through this. And she cries out...
Why, Thomas? Why?
It's okay. I'm here for you.
But they were real.
I'll move back in, I'1ll-- what?
They were real Warhols, damn it! As she shakily gets to her feet (CONTINUED)
How dare they? How dare they claim they weren't authentic? And it washes over Thomas.
That's what this is about? Her makeup smeared all over her face. Horror in her eyes.
How dare they? EXT. THE CONDE NAST BUILDING/LOBBYвЂ” DAY Thomas greets ARI WOLF, Thomas' age, in the manse foyer o Times Square.
Thomas. I was surprised when my receptionist told me you were here to see me.
I know, it's been awhile. They walk to a coffee stand.
Riverdale. Ari orders. Thomas waits. Then...
How can I help you?
I'm at Kenta now.
Working for Dad.
Yeah... anyway we're interested in a writer who is with Bennett that you interviewed last year. Ari sips his coffee.
Ahh... Julian Stellars. (CONTINUED)
No address on the guy or anything. Ari heads back toward the elevator bank. Thomas with him.
His real name is W.F. Gerald.
I know. I got nothing. Ari calls for the elevator.
I can't tell you where he lives, Thomas, that'd be unethical.
Unethical? Ari, you used to steal your mother's Valium and sell them to Sophomores. Ari smiles, the elevator doors open and he gets in.
I really can't. But listen there's a bar in Williamsburg called "The Red Lion." Have a drink there. As the doors close.

Have a few. INT. SUBWAY STATION вЂ” NIGHT Thomas waits for the train. He scans down the black tunne Nothing but the still darkness. Then he sees something on the track... a mouse. Then another and another. As the mice scurry from the tun and disburse to both sides.
Train's coming. Just then he looks down the tunnel to see the headlights. INT. THE RED LION вЂ” NIGHT (CONTINUED)

A small dark neighborhood bar. Thomas heads in, looks around. The obligatory alcoholics with their tired eyes. Thomas checks his watch, spies a "Golden Tee" machine, or a beer and gets change. He grabs his beer and makes his w to the machine. As Thomas fills the machine with quarters, he can't but h notice the man painted with TATOOS staring. This man may want to kill him. INT. RED LION вЂ” LATER Thomas and Tattoos are rapt in the game.
I should use a three wood here.
Too much club, look at the wind. Thomas looks away from the machine to see W.F. head in an take a seat at the bar. The bartender doesn't have to ask what he wants, just drops it down.
He's here. Tattoos looks over to W.F. then shakes Thomas' hand.
Good luck, my man. W.F. blankly stares ahead at the muted TV droning sports highlights. Drinks his drink. In his world. Until...
Did you finish it? W.F. turns to Thomas. Smiles. W.F. Yes. I did.
You didn't say goodbye. W.F. I should've never said hello. (CONTINUED)
Why? W.F. lets out a deep sigh, knows where this is going to g W.F. Because it wouldn't be fair.
To Karen and Benny? Thomas slides over the picture of him winning the tennis match, W.F. looks down at the picture with no expression.

Tell me about "The Only Living Boy In New York." W.F. nods in an order for another round. W.F. It's about three people. Two artists and a beautiful woman. One of the artists has talent and the other doesn't. No matter how hard he tries, no matter how badly he wants it... he just wasn't kissed by God in that way.
But he has the girl. W.F. Yes, they're married and they plan to start a family... only they have a little problem. As the bartender places down the drinks.
He's infertile and they ask their talented friend for help. W.F. You've a knack for story, Thomas. And Thomas pierces the look right at W.F.
I get it from my father. W.F. lets it hang, until... (CONTINUED)
W.F. takes After W.F. 95. (2)
Well, the story takes place in the seventies and they don't use invetro fertilization in those days. They use a cheap bottle of Cabernet and a Van Morrison record.
And the husband's on board? W.F. They want someone they know. Someone they love. a swig of his drink. Continues...

Of course this artist... the one with the talent, he's flattered. Of course he agrees. (and then) He and the girl walk the city for hours that night. Both of them so nervous. They end up at Washington Square Park, they dance to no music and then the rest comes easy.
And that's where he realizes he loves her. At the fountain in Washington Square. W.F. Yes, Thomas, you've figured it all out. finishes his drink.
So the couple gives birth toa wonderful son. The husband gives up art and becomes a very successful art dealer. And they fall into Upper-Manhattan and all that means.
And the other artist? (CONTINUED)

He sees critical success, never marries, takes on many lovers but never love. He watches the boy grow from a far, sees his talent alive with-in this child. W.F. takes a breath. Lights a cigar. The bartender slides over an ashtray from under the "No Smoking" sign.
And he so desperately wants to connect with his son. To tell him everything, to show the boy his genetic gift... to teach him how to use it. (and then) But of course... he never does make contact.
Until? W.F. Until he does something selfish. Until he decides it's all going to be his next book.
I thought he was an artist? W.F. He is, Thomas... I'm not. Like I said... thinly veiled.
So he contacts his son. W.F. Yes, actually moves in next-door. To write this story. His story. And W.F. Gerald, aka Julian Stellars, looks right at Thomas... looks right at his son.
Your story. EXT. LOWER BROADWAY вЂ” NIGHT Thomas walks. It rains. He stops and looks at the city. Ponders it. It all thinks it's so important. (CONTINUED)
And Thomas looks up at a poster on a scaffold for that exhibit at the Met. The poster with Rodin's "Hand Of God" As the rain falls down on him... as his eyes narrow in on it...
So it has come to this... And he just stands there. Just staring at the picture...
Darkness. Then a loud KNOCK. Thomas turns on the lights a moves to the door.
Who is it?
Thomas. Thomas opens the door but doesn't let him in.
You need to get uptown.
Did you tell her? Nathan looks spent... completely exhausted.
She found out. As Thomas quickly gets dressed.
How?
Rene Bradford told her, it's a long story. I called the police, I'm afraid she might try-- Thomas is already out the door. Heading down the...
Jesus. (CONTINUED)
I'd go but... I don't think it'll help. And Thomas turns to face Nathan...

I agree... Dad. With that, Thomas bounds down the stairs. EXT. UPPER WEST SIDE вЂ” NIGHT Thomas runs in the rain from the subway down Broadway. EXT. WEBB RIVERSIDE DRIVE BROWNSTONE вЂ” NIGHT Thomas runs around the corner. Stops on the dime. Ambulances scream outside of his parents brownstone. And Thomas sees his mother on the stretcher being carted into the ambulance. She is unconscious and has an oxygen mask on her face. The sight is crippling. As Thomas falls to his knees. His tears being washed away the rain. INT. ST LUKES HOSPITAL вЂ” NIGHT Nathan greets Thomas in the waiting room.
They pumped her stomach. She's going to live. Exhausted and emotionally drained, Nathan sits, throws hi head in his hands.
What was I supposed to do? Keep living a lie? Allow myself to be hijacked by her threats of this? Thomas stares blankly ahead.
No.
I wasn't in love with her anymore. You have to answer to love, Thomas. (CONTINUED)
I agree. Just make sure Johanna loves you before you marry her. Nathan looks up.
I think she does. Thomas nods and heads for the door.
You might want to ask her about Irwin Rosenthal.
What's that suppose to mean? Thomas? Thomas just keeps walking.
Where the hell are you going? Without looking back.

To answer to love. And with that, Thomas is gone. EXT. MIDTOWN вЂ” NIGHT Pouring rain. Thomas tries to hail a cab but they're all filled. And he starts to run. Through midtown... And Thomas runs... through the Las Vegas of Times Square. and it rains... on the charm of Chelsea... and Thomas run through the thin doglegs of the West Village... and it rains... on the multicolored fire escapes of The East Village... and Thomas runs... into the immigrant-cum-hips miasma of the Lower East Side. And Thomas finally stops.
Thomas frantically hits the buzzer. Mimi appears.
Thomas, what are you doing?
Mimi! (CONTINUED)
Thomas looks up at the rain clouds yielding to the full m
Will you walk with me? As she steps out onto the stoop.
My flight leaves in two hours.
I'm not perfect Mimi. I didn't even know who I was until tonight. I was hurt that you wouldn't have me and shocked that she would. As he catches his breath.
The world isn't black and white, it's gray. It's gray, Mimi.
Okay, Thomas. It's okay. Thomas looks up to the sky.
It's not raining anymore. She nods.
And I love you. He offers his hand.
Will you come with me? As she takes it.
Where? EXT. WASHINGTON SQUARE PARK/FOUNTAIN вЂ” NIGHT A moon so bright you could read by it.
dance by the fountain... to no music. (CONTINUED)
It's a test, Mimi. A litmus test To know if you're in love. She bites her lip, looks into his eyes.
And are you, Thomas?

This test wasn't for me. She nods... slight but determined. And she slowly kisses him. And he kisses her back. As they continue to dance by the light of the moon... INT. ROLLING ACRES CENTER FOR WELL BEING/JUDITH'S ROOM вЂ We're in an inpatient center. A nice one. The room is comfortable and private. Time has past. Judith lies in her bed and reads. A hard copy of "The Onl Living Boy In New York." A knock on the door. Thomas slowly heads in. Judith puts down the book
Hi Mom.
Thomas... She's obviously medicated.
I brought somebody. Remember that friend I wanted you to meet. Thomas opens the door to reveal.
holding a bouquet of flowers. Nervous as hell.
Walter. W.F. Judith. (CONTINUED)
Walter? W.F. brings the flowers over. W.F. That's what the "W" stands for. Judith holds out both hands. wW.F. takes them.
Oh, Walter, it's been so long. I haven't been well. W.F. But Thomas said you're getting better. She dotes on her son...
He's a good boy. Thomas leans against the door
I've read every one of your books. They're all terrific except "Remembering Kyla." I hated the ending of that one. W.F. accepts that. And Judith whispers...
I had to go to Starbucks to read them so Nathan wouldn't see. And she holds up his newest.
Walter, you've finally found an mass audience. She turns to the door.
Thomas-- ? But Thomas isn't there. He's slipped out of the room.
He seems to have left us alone. (CONTINUED)
With a smile... W.F. Yes, he has. EXT. BRYANT PARK вЂ” DUSK Thomas walks through the park. With confidence, he greets
Thanks for meeting me here. Nathan is dressed down, looks like shit, unshaved. They walk.
Did you find an apartment yet?
I just looked at something on Allen.
The Lower East Side?
It's affordable. Your mother's lawyer's a maniac. They've frozen almost everything. Nathan produces the "The Only Living Boy In New York."
People are reading fiction again.
What do you think of it? With a defeated sigh...
Riveting, brilliant, accessible...
My book is getting published.
I know. Someone slid me the galleys. I loved the letter you wrote to loss. (CONTINUED)
Nathan stops and takes a breath.
I'm selfish, Thomas. It's how I became so successful. But you should know... I loved you. I just didn't like you very much.
I know.
It was his talent. I hated it. It was so fucking effortless. And when I saw it inside of you... His word trail off into thoughts, until...
It's over with Johanna. She was sleeping with that billionaire.
He's not a billionaire anymore since his divorce.
She was going to marry me all the while keep it going with him. Does that make any sense?
People are not always clean and happy, Dad. People are layered and wounded and fragile. And they walk in silence, until...
Did you buy it? Thomas stops and removes something from his pocket. A ring box. He opens it and shows Nathan.
It's beautiful. EXT. GOTHAM BAR & GRILL вЂ” NIGHT The busy restaurant illuminates out onto 12th street. We stay outside while Thomas goes in. (CONTINUED)
